caption.p: Vaccination with MAYV/IRES strain protects mice from wild-type MAYV challenge. Six-week-old BALB/c mice were inoculated or not with MAYV/IRES (2 × 10 5 PFU/50 μL, i.pl.) and 28 days later mice were challenged with 2 × 10 5 PFU/50 μL of WT-MAYV at the same hind paw. Three days later, several analyses were performed. ( a) Experimental design. ( b) Mechanical hypernociception was assessed at day 3 after virus inoculation, as described in figure legend 1. ( c) Differential cell counts on blood were represented as number of leukocytes, mononuclear cells and neutrophils normalized on % of total cells counts. ( d) Neutrophil influx to the hind foot was measured indirectly by evaluation of MPO activity. ( e) Macrophage influx to the hind foot was measured indirectly by analysis of NAG activity. ( f–j) Plaque assay analysis of hind paw ( f) PLN ( g), quadriceps muscle ( h), spleen ( i) and serum ( j). Results are shown as the log of PFU per/g of tissue or PFU per/mL of serum. ( k) Shows semi-quantitative analysis (histopathological score) after Hematoxylin & Eosin staining of hind paw sections of control and MAYV-infected mice three days after wt MAYV inoculation. Representative pictures from hind paw sections. MOCK- not-infected. Results were expressed as median ( f–j) or mean ± SEM ( a–e and k) and are representative of two experiments. Original magnification: 200×. Scale bar: 100 μm. * for p < 0.05 when compared to control uninfected mice (MOCK). #p < 0.05 when compared to naïve wt MAYV infected group, as assessed by one-way ANOVA followed by Newman-Keuls post-test. Dashed lines are representative of naïve mice, which received MAYV/IRES.
